Author: Peter Clines
Notes: A speculative fiction novel which explores the Cthulhu Mythos in a contemporary setting

Title: The Adventures of Samurai Cat
Author: Mark E. Rogers
Notes: The character Samurai Cat traverses time and space on a mission of revenge , and at one point wreaks havoc in H. P. Lovecraft 's The Shadow Over Innsmouth

Title: Afterlife with Archie
Author: Archie Horror
Notes: A comic series in which Sacthubrina ends up at an otherworldly asylum run by Dr. Lovecraft after setting off the zombie apocalypse in the series . Due to her use of the Necronomicon she has inadvertently awakened Cthulhu , who intends for her to serve as his bride

Title: All-Consuming Fire
Author: Andy Lane
Notes: This Doctor Who Virgin New Adventures novel is set on a planet called Ry'leh and features an alien claiming to be Azathoth . It also equates several pre-existing Doctor Who monsters with Mythos creatures , claiming Fenric ( from The Curse of Fenric ) is Hastur , the Great Intelligence is Yog-Sothoth , and the Animus ( from The Web Planet ) is Lloigor

Title: And Another Thing
Author: Eoin Colfer
Notes: The final installment in the Hitchhiker 's Guide to the Galaxy series , and , in a humorous vignette , features Cthulhu interviewing for the position of god of the planet Nano

Title: Astronomicon minorem
Author: Khurt Khave
Notes: Main religious text of the First United Church of Cthulhu

Title: Awoken
Author: Serra Elinsen
Notes: A young adult paranormal romance about a girl who falls in love with Cthulhu who appears at her high school in the guise of a teenage boy . The novel was created by internet film critic Lindsay Ellis and her friends Nella Inserra and Elisa Hansen , along with their fanbase as a parody of Twilight and subsequent novels of the young adult paranormal romance genre

Title: The Book of the SubGenius and other SubGenius literature
Author: J.R. Bob Dobbs and The SubGenius Foundation
Notes: Contains many references and allusions to the Cthulhu Mythos , such as identifying J.R. Bob Dobbs ' real identity as Nyarlathotep and numerous mentions of the Elder Gods and Great Old Ones , who include SubGenius deities such as Jehovah 1 and the Discordian /SubGenius deity Eris Discordia , and mentioning Cthulhu as one of the common choices for a ShorDurPerSav ( short-duration personal savior )

Title: The Call of C'rruso
Author: Mark Shaw , Laura Shaw and Flemming Andersen
Notes: In Donald Duck # 16 , this Disney comics adventure story is a loose parody of the Cthulhu Mythos . Wannabe star singer Donald Duck is taken to the lost city of Sp'too , where the many-eyed monster-god Pf'legmwad lies sleeping - with all of our world existing only as a part of his dream . Mr. C'rruso , a humanlike manifestation of Pf'legmwad 's mind , thinks that Donald 's quacky singing voice will wake the monster up , as it eventually does

Title: A Colder War
Author: Charles Stross
Notes: A novella that blends the political fiction and technothriller genres with the Mythos

Title: The Crawlin ' Chaos Blues
Author: Edward Michael Erdelac
Notes: A blues singer in 1964 who makes a deal with Nyarlathotep for fame and fortune

Title: Crouch End
Author: Stephen King
Notes: A short story concerning a young couple lost in the London suburb , featuring several references to the Mythos

Title: Darkwing Duck
Notes: A story arc of the comic book series involves the criminal organization F.O.W.L . unleashing Duckthulu , an obvious parody of Cthulhu

Title: Destiny : The Sacred City
Author: Andrew Lawrenson
Notes: The conclusion in the Brotherhood of the Star trilogy , in which the protagonists must face a final battle against the dark cult and their plans to raise an ancient evil

Title: Discworld ( series )
Author: Terry Pratchett
Notes: Numerous allusions exist throughout the series ; the most explicit of these is the Necrotelecomnicon , after Lovecraft 's iconic Necronomicon grimoire

Title: The Dream-Quest of Vellitt Boe
Author: Kij Johnson
Notes: A novella set in the dreamlands and featuring an appearance by Raymond Carter , a former lover of the protagonist , in a subtly feminist re-imagining of Lovecraft 's The Dream-Quest of Unknown Kadath

Title: Famous Monsters of Filmland
Notes: A variant cover for issue # 281 featured Cthulhu locked in battle with Godzilla

Title: Green Lama Unbound
Author: Adam Lance Garcia
Notes: The Green Lama , a pulp hero from the 1940s , battles Nazis as they attempt to raise Cthulhu . Features strong elements from the Mythos

Title: Good Omens
Author: Terry Pratchett & Neil Gaiman
Notes: Hastur appears as one of the Dukes of Hell

Title: I , Cthulhu
Author: Neil Gaiman
Notes: A short story on Gaiman 's website featuring Cthulhu dictating an autobiography to a human slave
